data.title: Tesla is facing a fork in the road, says analyst
data.text: Dan Ives of Wedbush Securities and Jed Dorsheimer of Canaccord Genuity join CNBC's "Closing Bell" to discuss Tesla's anticipated Q2 productions numbers.

data.title: 3 Companies That Show Why Founder-Led Businesses Succeed
data.text: Studies have shown that founder-led businesses outperform other companies in the S&P 500 at a staggering rate. What gives these companies such a competitive edge?

data.title: Tesla's Q2 Delivery Number Could Cause A Big Move
data.text: This week will bring some of the most important news in what has been a disastrous year for Tesla, Inc (NASDAQ: TSLA) investors.

data.title: Will Tesla Create A New Delivery Record In Q2 2019?
data.text: Tesla (NASDAQ: TSLA) saw its vehicle deliveries dip by 30% sequentially in Q1’19, but the company is looking to turn things around in Q2, indicating that it wants to beat its previous quarterly record of 90,700 deliveries achieved in Q4’18. Tesla CEO Elon Musk indicated that the company was within.

data.title: Tesla Could Have Easily Sold A Record Number Of Vehicles But The Devil Will Be In The Details
data.text: Tesla could have easily sold a record number of vehicles since it had over 10,000 in transit at the end of the March quarter, and a number of buyers may have pulled the trigger last month vs. waiting until July or August due to the Federal tax credit being halved again on July 1.

data.title: Analyst explains why he gave Tesla the lowest price target on the street
data.text: Jeff Osborne, managing director and senior research analyst at Cowen, discuss what to expect from Tesla's second quarter delivery numbers and why he's given Tesla the lowest price target on the street.

data.title: 5 Overrated Growth Stocks to Sell Now
data.text: Beneath the surface, not one of these popular stocks is strong enough to tempt me.

data.title: Electric cars grab almost half of sales in oil-producing Norway
data.text: Almost half of new cars sold in Norway in the first six months of 2019 were powered by fully electric engines, up from just over a quarter in the same period last year, ensuring the Nordic nation retains its top global ranking in electric vehicle sales.

data.title: Here's what to expect from Tesla's Q2 deliveries
data.text: CNBC's Phil LeBeau reports on what to expect from Tesla's second quarter delivery numbers.
